title: Lee Sin Q: Does the initial Q need to deal damage?
body:
Clearly Lee Sin will always be a priority in Riot's meta, but does this initial Q need to deal damage? Free cast low cool down gap closer needing to deal damage even if Lee Sin doesn't initiate, which is the purpose of the skill essentially.... Make the player decide whether or not to engage/gap close on an enemy to force a team fight or go for a kill. 

Seems excessive for Q to have so many functions and deal damage @ no cost.

replies.body: I feel like it's the least annoying thing about lee sin actually...

Well Riot is all about having clear strengths and weaknesses, if that initial damage is not part of his core identity it's just unnecessary strength. Get rid of the initial damage and slightly increase the execute damage on the second cast. Now using Q as an initiator is considerably less rewarding.

I have no problem with the initial Q dealing a small amount of damage.

What bothers me about it far more is how long the duration of the mark is.

If a Lee Sin comes in to gank you and hits his Q, you can't flash away to avoid him until either a) he dashes to you or b) the mark wears off.

On paper, three seconds doesn't sound like a very long time, but in a gank situation three seconds where you can't flash or use other mobility to escape is a very, very long time.
It also gives the Lee player too much time to judge the situation before committing to an attack.

Actually, if he hits the Q near max range, flashing can put you outside of the range of the 2nd activation (if you didn't know, he can't fly in on you if you are too far away, even with a mark)

Also, flashing can put him under tower / too far away from his team to be safe.
I did know (though it's usually not applicable in the scenario I was describing), but upvoted for spreading knowledge.
They just need to remove wardhopping from Lee, then he wont be faceroll OP anymore.
Lee sin may be overpowered but he's not faceroll and he's not close to being faceroll overpowered neither.

Honestly no and i'd be ok with them moving all the damage to the second part of his q. Anyone wanna explain why this isnt a good idea?
He'd be useless in all forms of teamfights, since his Q will become telegraphed. You also wouldnt have any ranged abilities to poke with, which nearly every champ has

Counterargument:

How would the Q be any more "telegraphed" than it already is? In teamfights, his Q1 is far more useful as a threat than for damage, pressuring people into playing differently while Q1 is on them, this would be unaffected by Q1 dealing no damage.

This would be a good time to really solidify that Lee is balanced around jungling. The ability to poke from range is not why anybody would pick Lee Sin jungle. This would not be the first time Riot has decided to balance a champion for one specific role. Thresh and Leona are great examples of champions that were created as a solo laner concept, but in practice were found better suited to support, and were then balanced strictly around being supports. Riot has also changed several other champions to put them onto just one role / a different role for balance purposes. {{champion:12}} {{champion:117}} {{champion:76}} {{champion:223}} also come to mind.

TL:DR - Damage on Q1 is nearly irrelevant in teamfights, the power lies mostly in the threat of engage at this time.
He doesn't need poke as a Jungler, at now point in LoL history have junglers been picked for their poke prowess, even Nidalee with formidable poke was contested for her high clear speed and powerful early skirmishes. This would be a good time to publicly solidify Lee as a jungler. Don't act like his laning matters, it hasn't forever now.
Q1 provides poke and a threat, using it ONLY for a threat is like throwing Viktor ult infront of someone to make them walk away; its just wasting a CD

Wasting a 7-4 second CD basic ability is not the same as wasting a 100-60 second CD ultimate.

Also, if you are picking Lee Sin over another jungler for his MAYBE ~200 damage single target lategame poke, then you are either lying to me, or just plain stupid.
It doesnt matter that I dont "pick him" for it, its that he will literally be more useless in teamfights then he already is.

He has a TARGETED knockback, that can knockup 4 additional enemy champions.

It has good damage to ALL of those champions plus it does damage to the extra champs equal to a % of target HP.
How is he useless in teamfights?



Furthermore, I did not say you were picking Lee for poke, I said it would be an issue if you used his poke as your reasoning to pick lee over another jungler. Obviously if you can type a full sentence, you aren't picking lee SOLELY for his poke.

> Also, if you are picking Lee Sin over another jungler for his MAYBE ~200 damage single target lategame poke

Yes you did say I picked him for poke.

> It has good damage to ALL of those champions plus it does damage to the extra champs equal to a % of target HP.
How is he useless in teamfights?

I didn't say he is useless, I said he would become MORE useless then he already is. Without his Q poke he might end up turning in to an "ult bot" lategame; like Taric.

> He has a TARGETED knockback, that can knockup 4 additional enemy champions.

I shouldn't have to make those calculation and outplay the enemy team JUST to be useful in a teamfight.

" I said it would be an issue if you used his poke as your reasoning to pick lee over another jungler."

"Also, if you are picking Lee Sin over another jungler for his MAYBE ~200 damage single target lategame poke"


Do you see how I qualified it as a factor in part, not a sole reason?
Or do I have to assume your weren't lying to me about picking lee for poke, but rather the other option?

It's a factor of what makes him viable, taking it away could make him not viable. People hate high skill cap champions, so they ask for them to be gutted. Azir, Kalista, Lee Sin, Ekko, and Yasuo are all getting that treatment. But riot has been smart enough not to take things out of their kits that have been needed.

Oh, right. I get it now.

3 things i hate about Lee the most:

1. Base MS. On champion with 2 mobility spells and one knockback, 350 base ms. Seriously?
2. Instant W jump. It's so fast you cant react properly. W, then instant Q if he is far away, or W and instant R if he got you by his super fast base MS. Slow his W jump speed please.
3. Q recast range. Right now you can just throw your Q and walk away, and still be able to recast it. That's how huge its range. Lowering it down even by 200 would make a great balance change.

Yes it does, this might sound insane but, it makes him WORSE at towerdiving.

The damage is almost negligible as it is, but he has to MARK you to dash at you, this means the second he marks you under turret he HAS to dash at you (or start eating towershots for free).

This stops him from simply marking you, walking to you  under turret and then hopping to you if you try to get away.
taking away the initial Q damage would make lee sin a jungle only player. he would be unable to last hit from a safe distance. his Q initial damage is not a problem.

Lee has not been a relevant laner for a long time now.

He would not be the first champion to have their viable roles narrowed in order to improve the balance of the game overall: {{champion:117}} {{champion:12}} {{champion:223}}

That would mean Riot would have to do one of two things to him:

a. Move the damage of the 1st part of Q to the 2nd part, giving it a 180% AD ratio and 340 base damage at rank 5. 

b. Buff some other part of his kit.

If they decide to roll with the former, Lee's burst damage would significantly increase throughout all stages of the game, given that he lands his Q. (Which isn't that hard to do, considering the best way to gapclose with Lee is to wardhop into near-point-blank range.) This would give you even less time to do something against him in the event of a gank where he lands his Q.

If they decide to pick the latter, then some other part of his kit is gonna get a major buff, considering that applying this change would mean that his Q literally loses half it's damage. Now, don't get me wrong, I hate to play against Lee as much as the next guy, but no champion deserves something like this unless they get an equal compensation.
Isn't there an option 3? Just nerf it?

"Free" still an easy to sidestep skillshot tho.
His Q should just deal max health damage,so it wouldn't burst squishes that hard.

slap a AD ratio on the max health damage and yeah it will be fine

i dont want that poppy shit where its like 8% max health damage at level 1 . . . TWICE
No, why does he need tacked on lifesteal and spellvamp? Why not just remove some of the unnecessary crap in his kit by getting rid of that and strengthening his shield?

Because this is actually a solution to him having excessive burst mitigation.
The idea here is that - in the long run - he has X amount of sustain. If he were to still reach X by only a shield, that would also translate to increased burst damage mitigation.

This mix of sustain + a shield is how he is reaching a specific level of jungle sustain without being too durable against burst damage.
My problem is why does he get 30% lifesteal and spellvamp? That sht needs to be toned down. In fact why even spellvamp his only magic skill is his E

To increase his jungle durability + map uptime potential without his shielding being absurd.

Exactly what I stated above.

His shield has a max value of 280 + 80% AP. Although he doesnt build AP, thats actually the highest non-ultimate base shield in the game besides Yasuos passive, which is broken anyways. Not to mention it shield 2 people. And to top that off, he also gets 30% lifesteal and spellvamp, which is higher than anybody else in the entire game. So yeah, both are pretty absurd as it is.

Yes, it has a large value in the LATER stages of the game, however when jungle sustain is in question his shield will be level 1, providing a 40 damage shield for 2 seconds.

2 seconds, by the way, is one of the shortest shield durations in the game.

When jungle sustain is in question, his W will be level 1, providing 10 lifesteal for 4 seconds.

It is important to remember that these values, as far as jungle sustain goes, are irrelevant unless they are the level 1 W values.
